definition[0]: to use your power or authority to change someone elseâ€™s decision
example[0]: The EU commission exercised its power to override British policy.
definition[1]: to be regarded as more important than something else
example[1]: The needs of the mother should not override the needs of the child.
definition[2]: to stop a machine doing something that it does by itself
example[2]: Can you override the automatic locking system?
definition[3]: to ignore a decision, rule, law etc made by a person or organization with less authority
example[3]: It has the power to override state banking laws to sell insolvent thrifts.
